text: Rhode Island elected its members August 30, 1825 after the term began but before the new Congress convened. Rhode Island law required a candidate receive votes from a majority of voters for election, as only one candidate received a majority in this election, a second election was held for the remaining seat. {| class=wikitable |- ! rowspan=2 | District ! colspan=3 | Incumbent ! colspan=2 | This race |- ! Member ! Party ! First elected ! Results ! Candidates |- | rowspan=2 | | Samuel Eddy | | Adams-Clay Democratic-Republican | 1818 | | Incumbent lost re-election. New member elected. title: 1825 United States House of Representatives election in Rhode Island
